concept.title: Running in Pure Java Mode
concept.shortdesc: can run in pure Java mode, meaning runs without native code.

section.p: Running in pure Java mode enables to run with some functional differences on unsupported platforms. Unsupported platforms include any platforms that are not listed in .

In pure Java mode, distributed system members still have access to 's caching and distribution capabilities, but the following features may be disabled:
Operating system statistics. Platform-specific machine and process statistics such as CPU usage and memory size.
Access to the process ID. Only affects log messages about the application. The process ID is set to "0" (zero) in pure Java mode.
